title: Bactopia pipeline parameters
description: A flexible pipeline for complete analysis of bacterial genomes

input_parameters.title: Required Parameters
input_parameters.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

fastqs.description: A FOFN with sample names and paths to FASTQ/FASTAs to process
fastqs.help: Created using `bactopia prepare`. Cannot be used with `--R1|--R2` or `--SE`

R1.description: First set of compressed (gzip) paired-end FASTQ reads (requires --R2 and --sample)
R1.help: Requires `--R2` and `--sample`. Cannot be used with `--fastqs` or `--SE` (unless `--hybrid` used).

R2.description: Second set of compressed (gzip) paired-end FASTQ reads (requires --R1 and --sample)
R2.help: Requires `--R1` and `--sample`. Cannot be used with `--fastqs` or `--SE` (unless `--hybrid` used).

SE.help: Requires `--sample`. Cannot be used with `--fastqs` or `--R1|--R2` (unless `--hybrid` used).

hybrid.description: Treat `--SE` as long reads for hybrid assembly.  (requires --R1, --R2, --SE and --sample)

sample.description: Sample name to use for the input sequences

accessions.description: A file containing ENA/SRA Experiment accessions or NCBI Assembly accessions to processed
accessions.header:
### For Downloading from SRA/ENA or NCBI Assembly
  **Note: Downloaded assemblies will have error free Illumina reads simulated for processing.**

accession.description: Sample name to use for the input sequences

assembly.description: A assembled genome in compressed FASTA format. (requires --sample)
assembly.help: Error-free Illumina reads will be simulated for down stream processing
assembly.header:
### For Processing an Assembly
  **Note: Assemblies will have error free Illumina reads simulated for processing.**

reassemble.description: The simulated reads will be used to create a new assembly.

datasets.description: The path to datasets that have already been set up
datasets.help: Bactopia Datasets are setup using `bactopia datasets`

species.description: Name of species for species-specific dataset to use
species.help: These datasets include MLST schemas, reference genomes, protein sets, etc...

coverage.description: Reduce samples to a given coverage

genome_size.description: Expected genome size (bp) for all samples, a value of '0' will disable read error correction and read subsampling, otherwise estimate with Mash
genome_size.help: If `--species` is used, `min`, `median`, `mean`, or `max` can be used for `--genome_size`

outdir.description: Base directory to write results and Nextflow related outputs to

run_name.description: Name of the directory to hold results (e.g. ${params.outdir}/${params.run_name}/<SAMPLE_NAME>

skip_compression.description: Ouput files will not be compressed
skip_compression.help: Using this parameter can lead to a significant increase in the size of the outputs

keep_all_files.help: By default, intermediate files are removed. This will not affect the ability to resume Nextflow runs, and only occurs at the end of the process.

max_job_request_options.title: Max Job Request Parameters
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_retry.description: Maximum times to retry a process before allowing it to fail.
max_retry.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the number of retry attempts for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_retry 1`

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory (in GB) that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory 8`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time (in minutes) that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time 60`

nextflow_parameters.title: Nextflow Configuration Parameters
nextflow_parameters.description: Parameters to fine-tune your Nextflow setup.

nfconfig.description: A Nextflow compatible config file for custom profiles, loaded last and will overwrite existing variables if set.
nfconfig.help: This allows you to create profiles specific to your environment (e.g. SGE, AWS, SLURM, etc...).

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

infodir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

force.description: Nextflow will overwrite existing output files.

cleanup_workdir.description: After Bactopia is successfully executed, the `work` directory will be deleted.
cleanup_workdir.help: Warning: by doing this you lose the ability to resume workflows.

nextflow_profile_parameters.title: Nextflow Profile Parameters
nextflow_profile_parameters.description: Parameters to fine-tune your Nextflow setup.

condadir.description: Directory to Nextflow should use for Conda environments

registry.description: Docker registry to pull containers from.

singularity_cache.description: Directory where remote Singularity images are stored.
singularity_cache.help: If using a cluster, it must be accessible from all compute nodes. The NXF_SINGULARITY_CACHEDIR evironment variable overrides this parameter

queue.description: Comma-separated name of the queue(s) to be used by a job scheduler (e.g. AWS Batch or SLURM)

disable_scratch.description: All intermediate files created on worker nodes of will be transferred to the head node.
disable_scratch.help: Typically with clusters intermediate results are written to a 'scratch' space and only published result files are transferred back

awsbatch_profile_parameters.title: AWS Batch Profile (-profile awsbatch) Parameters
awsbatch_profile_parameters.description: Parameters to fine-tune your AWS Batch setup.

aws_region.description: AWS Region to be used by Nextflow

aws_volumes.description: Volumes to be mounted from the EC2 instance to the Docker container

aws_cli_path.description: Path to the AWS CLI for Nextflow to use.

aws_upload_storage_class.description: The S3 storage slass to use for storing files on S3

aws_max_parallel_transfers.description: The number of parallele transfers between EC2 and S3

aws_delay_between_attempts.description: The duration of sleep (in seconds) between each transfer between EC2 and S3

aws_max_transfer_attempts.description: The maximum number of times to retry transferring a file between EC2 and S3

aws_max_retry.description: The maximum number of times to retry a process on AWS Batch

aws_ecr_registry.description: The ECR registry containing Bactopia related containers.
aws_ecr_registry.help: This is useful if you've placed the Bactopia containers on a ECR registry

generic_parameters.title: Helpful Parameters
generic_parameters.description: Uncommonly used parameters that might be useful.

available_datasets.description: Print a list of available datasets found based on location given by `--datasets`

example_fastqs.description: Print an example FOFN expected from `--fastqs`

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.
monochrome_logs.help_text: Set to disable colourful command line output and live life in monochrome.

nfdir.description: Print directory Nextflow has pulled Bactopia to

sleep_time.description: The amount of time (seconds) Nextflow will wait after setting up datasets before execution.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

skip_fastq_check.description: Skip minimum requirement checks for input FASTQs
skip_fastq_check.help: This parameter is useful if you are confident your sequences will pass the minimum requirements.

max_downloads.description: Maximum number of samples to download at a time
max_downloads.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the number of downloads at a time

min_basepairs.description: The minimum amount of basepairs required to continue downstream analyses.

min_reads.description: The minimum amount of reads required to continue downstream analyses.

min_coverage.description: The minimum amount of coverage required to continue downstream analyses.

min_proportion.description: The minimum proportion of basepairs for paired-end reads to continue downstream analyses.
min_proportion.help: Example: If set to 0.75 the R1 and R2 must have > 75% proportion of reads (e.g. R1 100bp, R2 75bp, not R1 100bp, R2 50bp)

min_genome_size.description: The minimum estimated genome size allowed for the input sequence to continue downstream analyses.

max_genome_size.description: The maximum estimated genome size allowed for the input sequence to continue downstream analyses.

no_cache.description: Skip caching the assembly summary file from ncbi-genome-download

skip_qc.description: The QC step qill be skipped and it will be assumed the inputs sequences have already been QCed.
skip_qc.help: This is really only useful if you have already QC'd your reads, or have a specific need

skip_error_correction.description: FLASH error correction of reads will be skipped.

qc_ram.description: Try to keep RAM usage below this many GB

adapters.description: A FASTA file containing adapters to remove
adapters.help: By default, Bactopia will use the adapters provided by BBmap

adapter_k.description: Kmer length used for finding adapters.
adapter_k.help: Adapters shorter than k will not be found

phix.help: By default, use the phiX genome provided by BBmap

phix_k.description: Kmer length used for finding phiX174.
phix_k.help: Adapters shorter than k will not be found

ktrim.description: Trim reads to remove bases matching reference kmers
ktrim.help: Choices are: 'f' - do not trim, 'r' - trim ot the right, 'l' - trim to the left

mink.description: Look for shorter kmers at read tips down to this length, when k-trimming or masking.
mink.help: 0 means disabled. Enabling this will disable maskmiddle

hdist.description: Maximum Hamming distance for ref kmers (subs only)

tpe.description: When kmer right-trimming, trim both reads to the minimum length of either
tpe.help: Choices are: 'f' - do not equally trim, 't' - equally trim ot the right

tbo.description: Trim adapters based on where paired reads overlap
tbo.help: Choices are: 'f' - do not trim by overlap, 't' - trim by overlap

qtrim.description: Trim read ends to remove bases with quality below trimq.
qtrim.help:
Performed AFTER looking for kmers. Choices are: 

	'rl' (trim both ends, Default)
	'f' (neither end)
	'r' (right end only)
	'l' (left end only)
	'w' (sliding window)

trimq.description: Regions with average quality BELOW this will be trimmed if qtrim is set to something other than f

maq.description: Reads with average quality (after trimming) below this will be discarded

minlength.description: Reads shorter than this after trimming will be discarded
minlength.help: Pairs will be discarded if both are shorter

ftm.description: If positive, right-trim length to be equal to zero, modulo this number

tossjunk.description: Discard reads with invalid characters as bases
tossjunk.help: Choices are: 'f' - keep all reads, 't' - toss reads with ambiguous bases

qout.description: PHRED offset to use for output FASTQs

xmx.description: This will be passed to Java to set memory usage

maxcor.description: Max number of corrections within a 20bp window

sampleseed.description: Set to a positive number to use as the random number generator seed for sampling

shovill_ram.description: Try to keep RAM usage below this many GB

assembler.description: Assembler to be used by Shovill

contig_namefmt.description: Format of contig FASTA IDs in 'printf' style

shovill_opts.help: Example for SPAdes would be: '--untrusted-contigs locus.fna'

shovill_kmers.help: This would allow you to specify the kmer lengths to be used

nostitch.description: Disable read stitching for paired-end reads

unicycler_ram.description: Try to keep RAM usage below this many GB

unicycler_mode.help:
Choices are:

	conservative = smaller contigs, lowest misassembly rate
	normal = moderate contig size and misassembly rate (Default)
	bold = longest contigs, higher misassembly rate

min_polish_size.description: Contigs shorter than this value (bp) will not be polished using Pilon

min_component_size.description: Graph dead ends smaller than this size (bp) will be removed from the final graph

min_dead_end_size.description: Graph dead ends smaller than this size (bp) will be removed from the final graph

no_rotate.description: Do not rotate completed replicons to start at a standard gene

no_pilon.description: Do not use Pilon to polish the final assembly

skip_checkm.description: Skip running CheckM in the assembly QC step

checkm_unique.description: Minimum number of unique phylogenetic markers required to use lineage-specific marker set.

checkm_multi.description: Maximum number of multi-copy phylogenetic markers before defaulting to domain-level marker set.

aai_strain.description: AAI threshold used to identify strain heterogeneity

checkm_length.description: Percent overlap between target and query

full_tree.description: Use the full tree (requires ~40GB of memory) for determining lineage of each bin.

skip_pseudogene_correction.description: Skip identification and filtering of pseudogene

checkm_ali.description: Generate HMMER alignment file for each bin

checkm_nt.description: Generate nucleotide gene sequences for each bin

force_domain.description: Use domain-level sets for all bins

no_refinement.description: Do not perform lineage-specific marker set refinement

skip_adj_correction.description: Do not exclude adjacent marker genes when estimating contamination

contig_thresholds.description: Comma-separated list of contig length thresholds

nogenes.description: Do not add 'gene' features for each 'CDS' feature

rnammer.description: Prefer RNAmmer over Barrnap for rRNA prediction

rfam.description: Enable searching for ncRNAs with Infernal+Rfam

skip_prodigal_tf.description: If a Prodigal training file was found, it will not be used

cortex_ram.description: Try to keep RAM usage below this many GB

mash_sketch.description: Sketch size. Each sketch will have at most this many non-redundant min-hashes.

sourmash_scale.description: Choose number of hashes as 1 in FRACTION of input k-mers

minmer_ram.description: Try to keep RAM usage below this many GB

no_winner_take_all.description: Disable winner-takes-all strategy for identity estimates
no_winner_take_all.help: winner-take-all description: After counting hashes for each query, hashes that appear in multiple queries will be removed from all except the one with the best identity (ties broken by larger query), and other identities will be reduced. This removes output redundancy, providing a rough compositional outline.

screen_i.help: Inclusive unless set to zero, in which case only identities greater than zero (i.e. with at least one shared hash) will be reported. Set to -1 to output everything.

nucmer_breaklen.description: Value to use for -breaklen when running nucmer

assembly_cov.description: Target read coverage when sampling reads for assembly

min_scaff_depth.description: Minimum number of read pairs needed as evidence for scaffold link between two contigs

spades_options.description: Extra options to pass to Spades assembler

assembled_threshold.description: If proportion of gene assembled (regardless of into how many contigs) is at least this value then the flag gene_assembled is set

gene_nt_extend.description: Max number of nucleotides to extend ends of gene matches to look for start/stop codons

unique_threshold.description: If proportion of bases in gene assembled more than once is <= this value, then the flag unique_contig is set

ariba_no_clean.description: Do not clean up intermediate files created by Ariba.

snippy_ram.description: Try to keep RAM usage below this many GB

mapqual.description: Minimum read mapping quality to consider

mincov.description: Minimum site depth to for calling alleles

bwaopt.description: Extra BWA MEM options, eg. -x pacbio

random_tie_break.description: On references with matching distances, randomly select one.

disable_auto_variants.description: Disable automatic selection of reference genome based on Mash distances

max_target_seqs.description: Maximum number of aligned sequences to keep

keep_unmapped_reads.description: Keep unmapped reads, this does not affect variant calling.

bwa_n.description: Maximum number of alignments to output in the XA tag for reads paired properly.
bwa_n.help: If a read has more than INT hits, the XA tag will not be written.

amr_plus.description: Add the plus genes to the report

amr_report_common.description: Suppress proteins common to a taxonomy group

amr_organism.description: Taxonomy group: Campylobacter, Escherichia, Klebsiella Salmonella, Staphylococcus, Vibrio

amr_ident_min.description: Minimum identity for nucleotide hit (0..1). -1 means use a curated threshold if it exists and 0.9 otherwise

amr_coverage_min.description: Minimum coverage of the reference protein

amr_translation_table.description: NCBI genetic code for translated BLAST
